review name: If your baby has really bad eczema, you MUST try this lotion!!!
review text:
So, I have an almost 5 month old baby boy who was born with perfect skin and developed eczema at 4 weeks old. For the most part his skin has been usually rough and bumpy throughout his face and body. As soon as I noticed his problem I began using Aveeno lotion and wash. But his skin continued to get worse. I switched to exederm which helped his skin but didn't take the roughness and dryness away. While I continued to manage his skin condition, still it being rough and dry my baby had a really bad "flare up". He developed raw patches behind his knees, neck and arms. I was extremely stressed out and he didn't have an appointment until the week after. In the meantime I ordered several lotions to try. The first one I used was Eucerin eczema baby. I put lotion on him several times a day, just like I did with the ones I previously tried on him. The next day, my baby's face was no longer red or rough, still appeared a bit dry. The lotion didn't appear to sting or burn. By the second day I used this lotion, his skin was soft, and no longer dry. You have to give a try. I will stock up on Eucerin eczema baby for as long as I have to. I love how it helped my baby.

This is my honest review and I have NOT received anything in exchange for my review.

review name: In 3 days eczema is nearly gone!
review text: Since my son was 3 weeks old when he had this patch of eczema appear on his face and several patches on his arms and legs. He is 6 months old now and we've never been able to fully get rid of it. I've tried several products and so far this has had the fastest and best results. The before and after picture shows how much his skin has healed in 3 days with 2-3 applications a day. Hopefully we can get rid of his eczema for good this time!

I'm a pediatrician and have used many different over the counter eczema creams trying to find one I like the best. This is it! This is my all time favorite. I use it frequently during the winter when my hands get excessively dry from frequent washing. There is no smell to it. It is a thick cream without being overly greasy. I can usually go 2-3 handwashings before I feel I need to reapply it.

We have been battling this for three months using every kind of cream, ointment, and even having to resort to hydrocortisone because it got so bad as pictured and looked very painful in her elbow creases, behind her knees, and on her face. We will definitely keep using for the future.

The second I did, he was instantly calm. I will never, EVER use this product again.

review name: Hit or miss, but may not be good for sensitive skin
review text: I usually use baby dove eczema cream for my son, as well as vaseline(vaseline if his eczema is bad, and dove for moisturizing the skin that is okay during the time). The baby dove was sold out everywhere, and this was cheaper online than baby dove so I decided to try it.It had good reviews here and on YouTube, said by parents with children with eczema. I figured it would be good, especially because eucerin makes aquaphor, and that works great for us for other issues(redness,rash,scratch,scrape, etc). I put this on my son, and his skin broke out like I’ve never seen or break out before.Every single little tiny bump of his skin was raised(like goosebumps) but it wouldn’t go away, and he kept scratching. After a few days I realized it was the new cream(at first I thought he was having more dairy, which makes his eczema worse).I’ve since stopped using it on him, and his skin went back to normal.Not great for sensitive skin, so maybe test one leg or arm for a few days first.I don’t want to waste it, so I’ve been using it on my daughter who doesn’t have eczema nor sensitive skin, but skin has been getting a bit dry from the weather maybe(usually not dry).She likes it and says it smells good, so I’ll just continue using it as her moisturizer, only til it’s gone.Won’t be buying again.One last thing, the thickness is supposed to be pretty thick and creamy, but it’s not, it’s close to liquidy like a regular lotion.Baby dove eczema cream definitely thicker and creamier but not too thick. It makes a difference if the house is cool vs a little warm too.

review name: Eucerin Baby has saved my daughter's skin!

Her skin was dry and void of any moisture. On top of it, she turned out to have so many allergies pertaining to her skin so we were truly limited with what we could use on her. Although its been one day, the results are amazing! No hives! No outbreaks! Soft, baby soft, skin! We put the itch therapy cream on first after her bath to soak in and then the lotion. Her skin is SO moisturized this morning, her eczema patches that I would have to place Aquaphor on are healing faster and she's scratching less on her patches. I don't think anyone, except mothers and father who have gone through a similar situation, can understand the joy this brings to my soul to not see my child in discomfort everyday.

Thank you, Eucerin! I'll be buying this until the end of time!

review name: Works for Babies and Adults. Definitely Worth a Try
review text:
I am an adult that has had eczema for many years. I've tried lots of stuff from OTC, Rx, various cortisone treatments. Although most do work to curb the itchiness to some extent most eczema sufferers will tell you that treatment is a LONG TERM process which means you are using lots of this stuff for a long time. This becomes somewhat concerning especially when one is using the cortisone treatments over long periods of time. I used various cortisone treatments off and on for years and my skin would really start to suffer.
This stuff uses natural oatmeal to curb the itching combined with a number of moisturizers and skin protectants. It stops the itch and feels good going on. Doesn't leave any stickiness or residue behind. It has worked as well if not better than anything else I have tried including Rx and I haven't felt any adverse side affects with using it. This isn't going to magically make ones eczema disappear but it has helped a great deal with the itching at the least.
This is marketed for babies but as an adult eczema suffer I would highly recommend this to anyone at any age to try. The percent concentration of colloidal oatmeal is the same as other OTC products with colloidal oatmeal marketed to adults and others (1%).
There are a couple of these products available. One is a "Body Creme" and another "Instant Therapy Creme". The Instant one is supposed to have a cooling affect to help with flare ups but I honestly can't tell a difference. It isn't clear what produces the pro ported "cooling effect". Stick with the Body Creme as it is cheaper per ounce.

review name: Prehaps alright for more mild cases of Eczema
review text:
I really had no idea what Eczema was until my son was born. He will be 28 months old and he has struggled with Eczema since his birth. For anyone who is not familiar with Eczema, allow me to provide a short primer. It is a condition of the skin, in which the skin becomes extremely dry, resulting in itching and rubbing to the point where the skin cracks and bleeds. In addition, when there is radical shift in the weather, hot to cold or vice versa this can really flare things up. In my son’s case, if he becomes stressed or vexed this will promote him to scratch and itch. One of the many things that can ameliorate Eczema is creams and topical ointments.

I feel I must note in regards of reviewing this product, my son is under the care of a dermatologist and his pediatrician for his Eczema. Yet, I am still on a quest to find anything to aid my son’s Eczema, because the symptoms can only be controlled, not stopped. The hope is that over time the child will grow out of it or it will become more of a minor situation as he/she ages.
With regards to this review, I stopped using all topical creams prescription and over the counter for three days to see how this lotion would work. The only medication my son was given while this cream by Eucerin was used was an oral prescription given by his dermatologist to reduce itching.

This lotion by Eucerin is promoted on the notion that it provides relief for baby Eczema. I have to say that I really didn’t see any change in my son’s skin after using this product for several days. His skin did not become any worse, yet did not improve beyond the way his skin looked before the first application of this lotion.

I would say this lotion allowed my son’s skin to not become worse, if I had to provide an educated guess towards the worth of this product. I would also add that Eczema is a very tricky and frustrating medical condition and no two babies are going to respond the same to it. My son’s dermatologist and pediatrician both have said that they have seen worse cases of Eczema than my son’s. Those statements are surprising, because there are times where my son is so miserable I cannot imagine how it could be any worse than it already is.

In conclusion, it could be possible that my son’s Eczema is beyond point of where this over the counter lotion can aid him. However, I do believe that it helped maintain his skin for a few days and I believe if a child has a more mild case of Eczema this lotion can be of a stronger benefit. Nevertheless, if you are a parent of a child (or children) who have Eczema I would strongly advise speaking with a dermatologist if you can, if nothing else, educating oneself about this condition is one of the best ways to combat it.

After applying it diligently for a few days and not seeing any improvement, I ordered this. Her rash was significantly better not even 24 hours later. review name: No significant difference from Aveeno offerings
review text:
Courtesy of the Amazon Vine program, I have received a 2oz Eucerin Baby Eczema Relief Instant Therapy and a 5oz Eucerin Baby Eczema Relief Body Creme for review over the last month. Since the two products are very similar, I am writing this as a joint review.

I am not an infant. I have been an ezcema patient for over thirty years and I have tried more cream than I can remember. I am familiar with the Eucerin brand, but I think these are their newer offerings since in the past Eucerin is more of a competition to Cerave. However, these two Eucerin offerings are in fact more of a direct competitor to Aveeno because their active ingredient is Colloidal Oatmeal 1%, which is a skin protectant that is also used in many Aveeno creams.

Since they have the same active ingredient, there is really no significant difference in their performance in my experience with them over the last month. I don't think there is any surprise here. The two Eucerin offerings have reasonable smell (in fact the body cream smells quite like Aveeno), which is important: there is no fragrance since fragrance can potentially cause unnecessary skin irritation. Honestly, if you are already seeking out for ezcema treatment, that is the last thing you want. :)

The only difference between the two Eucerin offerings here is their thickness but NOT their concentration (both list the active ingredient at 1%). The body cream is thinner, while the “instant therapy” is thicker. In other words, the body cream creates a thinner moisture barrier, whereas the latter creates a thicker barrier. Personally I prefer the body cream since I don't like thick creams, but it is true that the body cream wears off faster since it is thinner.

As for the overall effect, well, I have to say that they are ok for everyday use. Honestly, I have already accepted my “fate” and I don't expect there is any cure to my ezcema. In this regard, these Eucerin products do not disappoint. They are good at keeping the skin protected, but they do not stop the itch or helps with the condition in the long term.

If I were in the market to look for moisturizers and if I want to use a colloidal oatmeal product, I would essentially price-compare between these and Aveeno and just buy the more affordable one. For what they are, I happily give them 5/5.

I am a big fan of Eucerin products, and this is no exception. My children and I have issues with allergic eczema, and strong contact to many common products moisturizing products. In addition, we all are extremely sensitive to dyes and perfumes. Eucerin products are almost all fragrance and dye free, and contain no irritating additives.

We used to live in a cold, desert climate, and the skin on my hands, and my children's hands would become dry and even bloody during the worst of the cold, dry season. After many years of trying all kinds of various products, Eucerin wins! Their "repair" line was one of the first I found to really work well on dry, chapped winter skin, and even the severe chapped areas of my children's skin from irritation or rubbing along the diaper gathers.

This particular product feels good on the skin, and gives almost instant relief to chapped, irritated skin. There is virtually no smell at all, and so far none of my very sensitive skinned family have had any reactions. The cream seems to work well, and quickly, and give almost instant relief and clears up the dry, painful skin in a few applications. All of us have episodes of allergic eczema, and so far both myself and my three children have tried the product with great success.

This cream is EXPENSIVE, and I am unclear why this particular formulation is better used for babies than some of the other, equally good, and much cheaper Eucerin products on the market. All in all, this is an excellent product, although I would really need to sit down and do a product to product comparison to see if I think its really work the difference in cost.

This product is amazing, the first time I put it on my son I immediately felt the difference with his skin, he wasn't dry and flaking his face wasn't red and sore looking it started to clear right up. The price is great considering w.m. sells for over $7 so you save a couple dollars here.
My only complaint would be that after applied to the baby if you put it in their hands and they suck on them the tiniest bit, the smell is terrible. And I know that eczema cream is ment to be scent free, but everything has a scent even the tiniest and this one stinks lol. Otherwise it's nothing that is going to stop me from buying it. It's amazing and so worth it.

review name: Some help with adult eczema, really helps itching
review text:
No babies here but I do have life long struggles with eczema. I find this cream somewhat helpful with rashes and lesions, especially if I use it as soon as I feel a rash coming (I get an aura). It goes on very easily and has no scent at all which is a huge bonus. Normally I still need a prescription product. Since I am an off label user, I can't really fault Eucerin for that.

I can say this is a terrific product to combat itching. I find that it breaks that itch urge almost immediately and allows me to focus on something more productive than an annoying itch. I routinely get hives and rashes other than eczema and the itch fighting aspect is superior to anything else I have tried. I'd use this as a full body moisturizer except the volume is too small. I do note this comes in a 5 oz tube which may useful for those with global itchy dry skin. I keep this around for bug bite season as well; many uses beyond eczema.

review name: No significant difference from Aveeno offerings
review text:
Courtesy of the Amazon Vine program, I have received a 5oz Eucerin Baby Eczema Relief Body Creme and a 2oz Eucerin Baby Eczema Relief Instant Therapy for review over the last month. Since the two products are very similar, I am writing this as a joint review.

I am not an infant. I have been an ezcema patient for over thirty years and I have tried more cream than I can remember. I am familiar with the Eucerin brand, but I think these are their newer offerings since in the past Eucerin is more of a competition to Cerave. However, these two Eucerin offerings are in fact more of a direct competitor to Aveeno because their active ingredient is Colloidal Oatmeal 1%, which is a skin protectant that is also used in many Aveeno creams.

Since they have the same active ingredient, there is really no significant difference in their performance in my experience with them over the last month. I don't think there is any surprise here. The two Eucerin offerings have reasonable smell (in fact the body cream smells quite like Aveeno), which is important: there is no fragrance since fragrance can potentially cause unnecessary skin irritation. Honestly, if you are already seeking out for ezcema treatment, that is the last thing you want. :)

The only difference between the two Eucerin offerings here is their thickness but NOT their concentration (both list the active ingredient at 1%). The body cream is thinner, while the “instant therapy” is thicker. In other words, the body cream creates a thinner moisture barrier, whereas the latter creates a thicker barrier. Personally I prefer the body cream since I don't like thick creams, but it is true that the body cream wears off faster since it is thinner.

As for the overall effect, well, I have to say that they are ok for everyday use. Honestly, I have already accepted my “fate” and I don't expect there is any cure to my ezcema. In this regard, these Eucerin products do not disappoint. They are good at keeping the skin protected, but they do not stop the itch or helps with the condition in the long term.

If I were in the market to look for moisturizers and if I want to use a colloidal oatmeal product, I would essentially price-compare between these and Aveeno and just buy the more affordable one. For what they are, I happily give them 5/5.

review name: Very nice, very soothing non-Rx alternative
review text:
If you have eczema, you probably know you won't get real relief except with a steroid cream or ointment, preferably a prescription-strength one. However, sometimes steroids are not appropriate -- for example, for a child who is apt to stick hands in mouth. That's where this cream is an excellent alternative. My child, thank goodness, does not have eczema, but I have periodic flare-ups. This cream is incredibly soothing the moment I put it on -- I think it's the colloidal oatmeal, which always seems to calm my tormented skin. The texture is smooth and emollient, and there are no ingredients like fragrance or color to set off any further irritation.

I can't recommend this as a primary eczema therapy, but for anyone who is avoiding steroids, or wanting a gentle, therapeutic cream for between steroid applications, this is an excellent choice.

review name: Great for all ages! Very soothing.
review text:
It is not an overstatement for Eucerin to call this cream "Instant Therapy." The relief you get from skin irritation is immediate. Upon application, there is a cooling sensation, and itching is instantly gone. It sounds too good to be true, right? Asked my husband to try it too (because I thought maybe I was making myself think the itching stopped fast), and he experienced the same relief.

My favorite part is that it is free of fragrance and steroids. The perfumes added to creams is too much for my sensitive olfactory nerves to bear. And you already know the dangers of constant steroid cream use. As an adult who suffers from patches of eczema and dry, irritated skin, this is great to add to the arsenal for maintaining healthy and happy skin.

If it's good for baby, why not for grown-ups too!

This cream is great. I just started using it, today in fact, but I already notice a difference in my skin. My hands feel soft and smooth. The cream is very thick, thicker than Cetaphil Body Moisturizer, and absorbs into the skin. This is a great product for babies and adults alike who have dry or eczema prone skin.

Update: October 12, 2016 - 1 week later:

I have used the cream once a day for a week, and the dryness is gone. I still put my moisturizer on at night, but the flakiness that develops during the day is gone. In fact, moisture now clings to my hands. I can tell. They are soft, smooth, and supple.

If you find this review helpful, please let me know. It helps me write better reviews.

My wife has been using various Eucerin products for years and recently I have joined her. As I have gotten older I have more and more of a problem with dry skin and mild eczema. This is sort of nasty stuff to treat even in its milder form. I must say that this Eucerin Baby Eczema Relief Body Crème does all it says it will do.
It is practically odorless which is a big plus as far as I am concerned and when applied it almost instantly soaks into the skin bring relief rather quickly. Unlike some other product; different brands, I have had no allergic reactions to this stuff.

This cream is a bit more costly than some I have used but as far as I am concerned it is worth every penny.

Don Blankenship
The Ozarks

review name: Expensive, but it works well and does not have much scent.
review text:
The two “babies” who tried this are 47 and 18 years old. This stuff works. It is expensive, but it does the job. I have also found that lotions which contain urea work well, and general cost less but sometimes have a more greasy feel.

I looked up the two unfamiliar active ingredients. Licochalcone is derived from licorice. It supposedly has some antibacterial properties. Ceramide-3 (a lipid or fat) which helps retain moisture is apparently added because those who have eczema have less of it. Oatmeal I did not need to look up!

Almost no smell and easy to rub in. I am not sure why this is marketed as for babies, it seems to work just as well on us grownups. This needs to come in a larger container at a lower price per ounce for those of us with more skin surface area!

review name: It took care of the problem.
review text:
My little granddaughter had a little patch of eczema on her arm. You could hardly see it, but you could certainly feel it. I think it's something we caught early. We started using this cream on it after every bath and started noticing improvement within a few days. Within a week, we could neither see nor feel any roughness.

The cream is not only effective, but it absorbs quickly and hardly has a scent. She made no complaint when we rubbed it in, so it obviously didn't bother her. (She's pretty effective at letting us know when something bothers her!) Even though the problem seems resolved, we continue to use it almost every day as protection because, for some reason, that has been a problem area in which dryness seems to come and go.

The creme comes in a 5.0 oz easy to squeeze tube and it's size makes it portable. I liked that it's fragrance free and seemed to have a somewhat thick consistency. The creme has calming oatmeal, ceramides to strengthen the skin's barrier and Licochalcone (licorice root) improves appearance of irritated skin.

I figured anyone could use it since it's dye, fragrance and steroid free, not just for babies. My hands have been particularly raw, chapped and uncomfortable this winter. I also use a lot of strong chemicals to clean with and that could be another reason for my skin issues.

I applied it multiple times a day and it never seemed to help with the dryness or chapped skin. I didn't feel that the application of the creme would soften the skin or feel like it was protecting it.

My girlfriend has eczema and I thought she might benefit from trying it. She said it felt like applying water to her skin. It wasn't thick enough or have enough of an emollient base. She prefers natural products and uses shea butter, which works wonders for her skin.

I'm not sure how this would work on a babies skin. It might work well since their skin is not as chapped or dry. It would be hard to recommend because it's a small tube and about $7.00 and it's not moisturizing enough. I think if you're a mom that's concerned about putting a natural product on your baby than this wouldn't be the creme for you.

review name: Nice improvement on the gold standard for eczema
review text:
We have a couple of people with eczema in our household. We agree with our physicians that Eucerin and similar products are the gold standard for effective control of eczema. This Baby version is a nice improvement:

Likes:
- Thinner than classic Eucerin (which is the thickest). Just a bit thinner, but it goes on easily, especially on very delicate skin.
- Adds colloidal oatmeal (1%) to the standard formulation.
- No added fragrance, but I smell a slight sweetness from the oats. I like it.
- 5 oz size: big enough to last, but still portable.

Dislikes?
None. A good tweak on the standard thick eucerin.

review name: Not a miracle worker, but OK
review text:
My little girl has had eczema since she was ambulatory. It's heat-generated, and virtually impossible to keep her arms free of red, itchy patches in summer--which of course we have plenty of. We've tried a gluten-free diet, dairy-free, Chinese medicine. The only thing that diminishes it quickly is steroid-based cream, which I use as sparingly as possible. The ONLY thing that works longterm is cool, dry weather.

That said, this cream at least keeps her skin calmer and not as itchy. The eczema doesn't go away with the use of it, but it gives her a reprieve from its symptoms.

So, it's not a sure thing for us, but it does bring some relief. It's worth trying if your little one is very uncomfortable.

review name: Special lotion good! Special lotion no itchy!
review text:
My son was born with sensitive skin, so I've tried many products--both conventional and homeopathic--on his seemingly endless parade of random blotches, rashes, and otherwise mysterious skin irritations. He has a prescription ointment for serious eczema breakouts (usually due to heat waves), but I avoid using it unless absolutely necessary.

This Eucerin Baby Eczema Relief creme is perfect for those come-and-go blotches of red that appear--usually the rash or irritation is gone within hours of application. However, I will let my son speak for himself, in all his 2-year-old wisdom. The following happened a few days ago:
SON: Mommy, itchy itchy! (points to red patch on leg)
ME: Oh no! What should we do?
SON: Special lotion! Special lotion! (runs off, gets tube of Eucerin Baby Eczema Relief, brings back)
ME: (applies lotion) Is that better?
SON: Special lotion good! Special lotion no itchy!

If that's not a 5-star endorsement, I don't know what is.

review text:

I would not use an adult OTC product to treat it so I picked this up at the local pharmacy. I selected this over similar products because I like Eucerin baby products having used them in the past.
I continued to bathe her in a lukewarm bath with Eucerin baby wash and then applied this to the patchy areas 3-4 x a day. The outbreak calmed down over the weekend and her skin was back to normal by Monday. I continued usage until her parents came home.
I liked this product because it creates a moisture barrier on the skin and keeps the skin moist and itch free. My tiny tot had no allergic reaction to it and it delivered almost immediate relief. The addition of oatmeal was great. I take oatmeal baths when my eczema flares up and it always makes things better.
While eczema depending on severity may necessitate a doctor's visit, this product definitely handles the small and less severe cases.

This is great for keeping rough, scaly skin soft and moisturized to prevent itching before it starts. If I had a hot-spot, this didn't do much to quell the itching in the short term, but I feel like it helps my problem areas before they flared up.

Cleared up baby's splotchy, dry, and red face after two peas sized administrations, including two baby pimples that had been there since birth (two months prior). The only lotion I will ever use on baby's sensitive face.

I felt so awful for her I took her to her doctor and they prescribed hydrocortisone but didn't work. Then I bought aveeno baby eczema cream, didn't work. After the second time I applied it finally the roughness and bumpy look was vanishing. It's like a miracle cream and I will keep purchasing.😃😃

+ It does not feel greasy or thick at all

review name: Gives Relief to Toddler with Eczema
review text:
My daughter has battled with eczema since she was an infant. We are very limited to the types of soaps, shampoos, and lotions she can use. In fact, several other brands of eczema lotions and cremes cause her eczema to flair up. Eucerin Baby Eczema Relief Body Creme actually works for her!

I really like this creme, as it goes on thick and lasts for the entire day. However, it does not clog the skin. It is one of the few products for babies and small children that prevents dry, itchy skin. It has a very light, pleasant scent, and my daughter's skin looks and feels healthy.

We live in Colorado, so the air is really dry and therefore so is baby's skin. He was developing some really dry patches on his elbows and knees, this stuff had his skin back to baby soft in a day!

review name: Works well, though a little slow to work into the skin
review text: This was tried on a toddler with very delicate skin. Though he did not currently have an eczema outbreak, the creme was very soothing and softened his dry, dry skin well. It took a few more seconds of rubbing the creme into his skin than some products, but there was no greasy residue feel as soon as it was absorbed. The lack of any strong aroma was a positive, and this is something we will plan on using when he has signs of significant skin problems.

I'd been fighting my toddler's eczema off and on for a year. It was so red and irritated, it resembled a poison ivy rash. This stuff reduced the symptoms overnight and in three days it was completely gone. Now I put on a little after his bath every night and his skin is perfectly soft.

Best thing ever! Ever since my daughter was 3 months old she started to get these dry patches and little red bumps on her legs and arms. Our doctors told us to keep her moisturized with baby lotion and limit her bath time. That method worked for a couple weeks but her skin started to get worse. Finally I went to Walmart in search of another moisturizer or cream to help and saw this product. It worked immediately after I put it on her. review name: Works Great on Tough Eczema Spots
review text: My son has dry, red cheeks on his face. I was using the Eucerin Baby Eczema Body Creme, but he still had the red cheeks. review name: Better results than we had with Aveeno

review name: Highly recommended, and we have tried them all

Actually works...unlike the Aveeno equivalent, for instance, which seems to almost be a placebo it was so ineffective (for us).

Highly recommended, and of course not just for baby...we use this on our kids aged from 3 up to 10.

Not only did this help to clear my sons eczema but it truly is INSTANT relief therapy. My 6month old will be scratching intensely. I'll apply this to the area and after a few moments he will stop. It feels good to the touch on his skin as well. I'll say I used it on his face near his mouth, he later had green , mucus-ey stool. Maybe from swallowing some as he was using his teethers. review name: Please sell in bigger containers. Those of us with eczema buy A LOT!
review text: My new favorite lotion. I would buy it by the gallon if they sold it that way. There are only 2 other lotions on the planet that I know of that don't burn and flare up my skin.

This is the best cream that I have ever bought for my baby. She is 10 months old and was suffering from raging rash and eczema. I have been using all sorts of Eucerin products over the years and have never had a bad one yet.
